page.title: 03THE VICAR OF QUARRINGTON
page.content: {Hugh Bailey}was Rector of{Silk {Willoughby}and{Quarrington}from l957 to his retirement in l984. He was chaplain of{Rauceby Hospital,}and made regular visits to the hospital every Friday. He divided his work as a Rector into three areas, people, paper, and prayer. He visited people in their own homes and in hospital, especially{Rauceby {Hospital,}which was situated within his pastoral district. He produced the parish magazine. He had to deal with many letters, papers and matters of finance. In connection with fund raising a{summer fete}was held and a stall was rented in{Sleaford Market {Place}just before Christmas for the sale of goods donated by parishioners. Much of his time was spent in private and public prayer.
